result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler M. Polum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.
Defendant to submit DNA sample.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: letter from defendant asking about jail time, Judge response sentences in 2 files run concurrently to each other, but consecutive to other charges
letter from defendant asking fines to run concurrent - Judge answer sitting off fines is not run concurrent to any other sentence
DNA proof of submission - already on file
3 statements

Defendant Tyler M. Polum in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Defendant Tyler M. Polum in custody.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim iimpact statements submitted  by DA.  Arguments by DA and defense as to penalty.  Court orders 210 days jail each count concurrent w/Huber and $10+costs.  1 day credit.  Appeal rights.
Absolute sobriety.  No contact with JC or AM. No entry into class B licensed establishments.

Attorney Steve Weerts appeared by video means for Defendant Tyler M. Polum.  Atty Haacke represents the defendant, but unavailable today.   Prosecuting Atty Scott E. Niemi appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
failed to appear 8-5-16
Defendant has 30 days to appear voluntarily or his cash bond will be forfeited.

Attorney Ronald Duane Haacke in court.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not in court.  Attorney Haacke unable to reach his client.  Commence forfeiture of bond money.  $2,000 cash warrant authorized.  Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on August 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing Hearing 6-7-16

Defendant Tyler M. Polum in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire filed w/NC pleas.  Court reviews rights, charges & penalties w/DE.  Atty Haacke requests sentencing date.  Court accepts waiver, plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 08:45 am.
